DataElement.preferredName: Medical Device During Intravesical Route of Administration Chemotherapy Hyperthermia Induction Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indication of whether or not a medical device was used to induce hyperthermia during the intravesical administration of chemotherapy.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Medical Device During Intravesical Route of Administration Chemotherapy Hyperthermia Induction
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any physical object that is useful for prevention, diagnosis, monitoring, or treatment of disease or other conditions._At some point in a given period of time._The administration of a drug within the urinary bladder._The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases._A condition characterized by an abnormally high body temperature. In a hyperthermic state, the hypothalamic set-point is normal but body temperature increases and overrides the ability to lose heat, resulting from exogenous heat exposure or endogenous heat production._The act of bringing about something.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Medical device - any machinery designed to aid diagnostic and medical therapies. Medical device has to be designed with rigorous safety standards. There are several basic types of medical devices: life support equipment used to maintain a patient's body functions; therapeutic equipment; monitors and detectors to measure the indexes of a patient's state; imagine machines and laboratory equipment used with diagnostic and status monitoring purposes. In insurance parlance, the term is usually synonymous with assistive device, although it may include medical supplies.

Concepts.definition: Any physical object that is useful for prevention, diagnosis, monitoring, or treatment of disease or other conditions.

Property.preferredName: During Intravesical Route of Administration Chemotherapy Hyperthermia Induction
Property.preferredDefinition: At some point in a given period of time.:Administration within the bladder.:The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.:A condition characterized by an abnormally high body temperature. In a hyperthermic state, the hypothalamic set-point is normal but body temperature increases and overrides the ability to lose heat, resulting from exogenous heat exposure or endogenous heat production.:The act of bringing about something.

Concepts.definition: At some point in a given period of time.
The administration of a drug within the urinary bladder.
The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.

A condition characterized by an abnormally high body temperature. In a hyperthermic state, the hypothalamic set-point is normal but body temperature increases and overrides the ability to lose heat, resulting from exogenous heat exposure or endogenous heat production.
The act of bringing about something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An object needed to perform a diagnostic, therapeutic or research activity.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
